alert.note: Alert for Southern Clearwater Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 18 at 2:25PM MST until February 21 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM SUNDAY TO 4 AM PST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches through this evening. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 15 inches for elevations above 3500 feet including Lolo Pass. 1 to 3 inches below 3500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches, with over 20 inches at Lolo Pass. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Dixie, Elk City, and Highway 12 Lowell to Lolo Pass. * WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM PST this evening. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 PM Sunday to 4 AM PST Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Monday night through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 15 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
